Instead, it seems to be a homepage or news listing page from a Hindi news website called "The Lallantop" with various news headlines and thumbnails. The HTML contains multiple news story previews in a grid layout, with headlines such as:
- "खालिस्तानी आतंकी अर्श डल्ला की गिरफ्तारी पर विदेश मंत्रालय बोला, कनाडा उसे भारत को सौंपे"
- "मर्सि़डीज ड्राइवर ने ऑटिज्म से जूझ रहे बच्चे को थप्पड़ मारा"

If you intended to have a fact-check article processed, could you please provide the specific HTML content of the fact-check article?
title: Major Mohit carried out an operation in 2004 at Shopian, 50 km from South Kashmir. Going by the name of Iftikhar Bhatt, he won the trust of Hizbul terrorists and then put them to death in their own house. He was highly appreciated for his bravery. Five years later, Major Mohit Sharma sacrificed for the country in a military operation in Kupwara.
vclaim: The provided content is not a fact-check article but rather appears to be a Hindi news website homepage containing various news headlines
